reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We enjoyed our overnight stay at Sabai@Kan in Kanchanaburi, it was perfect for our needs. Our group was four adults & one child, so we had two rooms (a double & a twin) and everything was adequate for a comfortable one night stay. The hotel is centrally located in Kanchanaburi, walking distance to restaurants and many (many!) bars - if that's your thing! We had our own car/driver from BKK, so we headed down to the riverfront to a very local floating restaurant away from the madding bar crowds. The staff at Sabai were pleasant but not fussy; breakfast was reasonable and everything worked smoothly. It's a pleasant oasis in a hot and dusty town, perfect for River Kwai sightseeing!
reviews.title: Perfect for overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in a ground floor 'Green' room. The rooms are very spacious and open onto the poolside garden. Rooms are provided with both bathroom and pool towels.
reviews.title: Nice place to relax after sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We travelled from Bangkok on the morning train to Kanchanaburi. After arrival and check in we had lunch in their restaurant and the food was fresh and very tasty. Breakfast is buffet style with many options and all enjoyable.
reviews.title: The hotel is cool, the staff is so so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is a comfortable 10-15 minute walk from the Bridge over the River Kwai. The Thailand-Burma Railway Centre and the Allied War Cementery are also located within walking distance. Good dining options are located nearby.
reviews.title: nice oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked the staff to organise a car and driver for a half day trip to Hellfire Pass (we wanted to take the train back from Nam Tok to River Kwai Bridge in the afternoon). Our driver was very helpful and included a stopover at Sai Yok Noi waterfall, along with a great recommendation for lunch there. His car was clean and new and the airconditioning was much appreciated. The staff were also very helpful in organising an afternoon of day spa treatment for my wife on the afternoon of our arrival.
reviews.title: A relaxing and friendly oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I booked this online. This hotel is fresh, clean, friendly, quiet and such a treat.
reviews.title: What a lucky pick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was a double with an extra bed in, and a real bedn not a flimsy little roll-a-way. the pool ws clean and cared for. the breakfast was resonable and the staff washed their hands and wore hairnets, ( first i have seen in Thailand.)
reviews.title: 3 nights in Kanchanaburi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I were on our 30th trip to Thailand & wanted to stay briefly in kanchanaburi to catch up with a thai friend who was renovating her home outside of Kanchanaburi township. Our friend recommended & booked Sabai@kan for us in a Green[lower] room. We have covered all of Thailand & have stayed in about 60 hotels from Tourist to Deluxe rating. We were pleased with our friend's choice. One pleasant surprise was the in room digital safe, which was not listed in the facilities, when we first checked their website. This is a "must' for us for security of our valuables.
reviews.title: Clean generous sized rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff could not be faulted in their efforts to make us welcome. Breakfasts were very good, laundry prices were very cheap & staff were able to book very cheap & reliable taxi & motorcycle taxi transfers in the area. There are good little restaurants nearby.The first night we dined in the Hotel restaurant & were pleased with the thai meal we ordered.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I did not tick the excellent circle as I reserve this rating for Deluxe or equivalent hotels. This hotel is very good & we have no hesitation recommending it.
reviews.title: New accommodation, set in lovely grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel after reading the good reviews on Tripadvisor and when we checked in and were taken to our room we weren't disappointed. The staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English and the room (standard) was clean, bright and airy with views over the beautiful well tended garden and pool. We'd booked in for 3 nights and were so entralled that we asked to stay an extra 2 nights.
reviews.title: Good but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, after one night in the room we decided not to extend our stay due to the noise from the live band at a venue just across the road which went on till gone 1am every night.
reviews.title: K. Lambrou

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower had little pressure and it was difficult to rinse shampoo from my hair. There was also no kettle in the room which I would expect for the price.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was OK, buffet style with a fairly good choice for both western and Asian tastes. We had lunch at their restaurant one day and that was also enjoyable with a good choice of menu.
reviews.title: Sabai Sabai @Kan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is little in the way of storage space in the rooms having just shelving units and no drawers so it is suitable for short stays only but then, I don't think Kanchanaburi is a place people tend to stay for a week.
reviews.title: A little oasis in pretty Kanchanaburi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place has plenty of positives. Before continuing, there is a suggestion for those arriving by train. When arriving at Kanchanaburi Station avoid the overpriced shuttle services offered by the hawkers. Instead head out of the station and on the right hand side is a telephone booth. Call the hotel and they will pick you up for free. Plus, at the conclusion of your stay they will drop you back at the station for no charge as well.
reviews.title: Excellent staff and pleasant grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best aspect of this place is undoubtedly the staff, particularly those on the front desk. The overall service as this hotel was one of the best I've encountered. They would easily share a laugh with you and are very accommodating on questions and requests.
reviews.title: A little oasis in Kanchanaburi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are tiled, clean and spacious - so there is plenty of space to spread out one's luggage. The bathrooms were not up to the quality of the sleeping area, and I had trouble getting the shower to operate at the correct temperature. I utilised the well priced laundry service, and all items were returned clean and undamaged.
reviews.title: Very good hotel with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was more than acceptable with a nice selection on offer - after feasting on this, one could easily not eat again until the evening. On the first evening I also ate dinner here, but did not think it provided the value when compared to other nearby options.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: However, before booking, there are two factors you should consider before any stay. Firstly, the rooms have a no food policy, and non-adherence to this rule will result in an infestation of ants. I had forgotten about some food not consumed on the train, and the next morning there were ants aplenty! For me, this is not an issue, but it is something to be aware of.
reviews.title: Still quality
